trans-unit.source: How to: Use Svcutil.exe to Export Metadata from Compiled Service Code
How to: Use Svcutil.exe to Export Metadata from Compiled Service Code
Svcutil.exe can export metadata for services, contracts, and data types in compiled assemblies, as follows:
To export metadata for all compiled service contracts for a set of assemblies using Svcutil.exe, specify the assemblies as input parameters.
This is the default behavior.
To export metadata for a compiled service using Svcutil.exe, specify the service assembly or assemblies as input parameters.
You must use the `/serviceName` option to indicate the configuration name of the service you want to export.
Svcutil.exe automatically loads the configuration file for the specified executable assembly.
To export all data contract types within a set of assemblies, use the `/dataContractOnly` option.
Use the `/reference` option to specify the file paths to any dependent assemblies.
To export metadata for compiled service contracts
Compile your service contract implementations into one or more class libraries.1
Run Svcutil.exe on the compiled assemblies.
You might need to use the `/reference` switch to specify the file path to any dependent assemblies.
To export metadata for a compiled service
Compile your service implementation into an executable assembly.
Create a configuration file for your service executable and add a service configuration.
Run Svcutil.exe on the compiled service executable using the `/serviceName` switch to specify the configuration name of the service.
You might need to use the `/reference` switch to specify the file path to any dependent assemblies.
To export metadata for compiled data contracts
Compile your data contract implementations into one or more class libraries.
Run Svcutil.exe on the compiled assemblies using the `/dataContract` switch to specify that only metadata for data contracts should be generated.
You might need to use the `/reference` switch to specify the file path to any dependent assemblies.
Example
The following example demonstrates how to generate metadata for a simple service implementation and configuration.
